column4: hey, does anyone know how to get ubuntu to redetect a sound card?
without a reinstall.
turn it off or take it out and then turn it on or put it back
with a boot in the middle of that process
in the same slot?
so turn off - take out - boot stuf
as I was saying turn it off then put it in again on a different but
bus (slot)
and btw is that an audigy?
so you are saying (just to be sure), take the pci card out while my pc is on, shut it down , switch it on and then put it in a different slot?
yeah it is an audigy.
alsamixer and unmute it :-)
enjoy :)
disable anything else that is there as audio
alsamixer gives me "alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such device"
okay there should only be one audio device that could be blocking it all

at the moment, if i open the sound prefs I get a blank drop down list for "default sound card", lspci shows the card, but I can't get ubuntu to see the card, I think the IRQ number mightve changed, I'm not great with pci hardware so i dont really know.

okay, my final comment on this, you can only have one sound device working at a time, put it in a different slot, a seek is done on boot up, when you have done that check if there is anything muted in alsamixer
thanks for the help :D
in a lot of cases they are the same machine
well the uk ones arent, my debian server gets about 180kb/sec on quiet times, my ubuntu desktop can get 270 ( peak bw) almost all the time
in the uk they are different machines ;-) however in most of the rest of the world they are on "good mirrors"
